explanations.A: Reading round, in a clockwise direction, from 0° at the top of the protractor, to follow the red angle marked, we get to 260°. This is the size of the angle.
explanations.B: This is how many degrees there are in one full turn but we only have part of a turn. Look at the red angle that is coloured in, we need to work out the size of that.
explanations.C: This would be the value of the full turn that has not been coloured. We are looking for the size of the red angle. Starting from 0° read round in a clockwise direction until you get to the other red line that makes up the angle. This is the value the question is asking for.
explanations.D: It is a reflex angle but the question is asking about the size of the angle not the type of angle.

explanations.A: There are 360° in a full turn. Reading the uncoloured part of the full turn gives a 135° angle. If we take this off 360° we get 225° not 305°. I think you have accidentally read the outside scale but we need to read from the inside scale as this is where the angle crosses zero.
explanations.B: There are 360° in a full turn. Reading the uncoloured part of the full turn gives a 125° angle. If we take this off 360° we get 235° not 305°. I think you have accidentally read the outside scale from the left to get the uncoloured part but we need to read the inside scale from the right as this is where the angle crosses zero.
explanations.C: There are 360° in a full turn. Reading the uncoloured part of the full turn gives a 45° angle. If we take this off 360° we get 315° not 305°. I think you have accidentally read the inside scale from the left but we need to read it from where the angle crosses zero.
explanations.D: There are 360° in a full turn. Reading the uncoloured part of the full turn, we get 55°. 360-55 = 305° so the shaded part is an angle of 305°.
